answerText: Barry Lyndon [accept either][10] This British novelist wrote The Luck of Barry Lyndon. His other works include Henry Esmond and one in which Captain Dobbin marries the widow of George Osborne, who died at Waterloo.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Northwestern A | 2 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: While serving as a spy for Frederick the Great during the Seven Years' War, this character encounters his uncle Chevalier Ballybarry, who teaches him to be a conman. For 10 points each: [10] Name this character who later wins a seat in the Irish parliament before winding up in Fleet Prison.
